title: Crabgrass Confidence Interval
question_text:
Rob applied preventative herbicide/fertilizer to stop crabgrass in his lawn. He applied $4$ levels of treatment, each to $4$ sections of his lawn at random, and recorded the change in crabgrass plants per square meter. The data is given below: Loading question supplement... Regression analysis was performed and a $98\%$ confidence interval for the slope of the true regression line of change in crabgrass on treatment was constructed.
$98\%$ Confidence Interval: $ (-1.134, -0.8364)$
Interpret the meaning of this interval in context.

choices.text: We are $98\%$ confident that the mean change in crab grass plants per square meter is between $-1.134$ and $-0.8364$ plants.
The slope of the true regression line relating change in crab grass and herbicide/fertilizer is between $-1.134$ and $-0.8364$ approximately $98\%$ of the time.
If Rob were to perform the same experiment many times, we would expect approximately $98\%$ of the sample regression slopes to fall between $-1.134$ and $-0.8364$.
Rob can expect the herbicide/fertilizer to kill between $-1.134$ and $-0.8364$ on $98\%$ of the sections of his lawn.
We are 98% confident that the interval from −1.134 to −0.8364 crab grass plants per square meter captures the slope of the true regression line relating change in crab grass and herbicide/fertilizer.
